intro: Microchilus colombianus, commonly known as the Colombian microchilus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests and montane grasslands. Its leaves are lanceolate and arranged alternately along the stem, while its flowers are often clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
